result.execSummary:
The defendant Andrew M Wapp III was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Schedule I, II Narcotics, a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant is NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program. Defendant IS Eligible for Substance Abuse Program AFTER completing the first 4 Years of initial confinement. Sentence credit of 151 days were granted.

superMiscConds.notes: Reimbursement for Buy Money to be paid/forwarded to Waukesha Co Clerk of Courts for City of Waukesha Police Dept. Costs to be paid as a condition of Extended Supervision.

Follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. 
Attend a minimum of 2 self help meetings per week.

Defendant not to reside with immediate members of his family. Maintain full time employment and/or school combination. 
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

Defendant Andrew M Wapp in court, in custody, with attorney Nicholas Martinez.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Konrad Paczuski, supervised by Kevin Osborne, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Recommendations by the State.  Arguments by the Defense.  Statement by defendant.

Court orders the following: 

Count 5:
- Total sentence: 10 years (Initial Confinement: 6 years, Extended Supervision: 4 years) Credit for 151 days
- Defendant IS NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration
- Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program after completing the first 4 years of Initial Confinement
- Court costs of $268.00 to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision.
- Buy Money of $250.00 to be paid to City of Waukesha Police Department as a Condition of Extended Supervision.
- DNA Surcharge waived
- DNA Sample waived
- Conditions of Extended Supervision:  Maintain absolute sobriety/Random UAs.  No use or possession of alcohol/drug paraphernalia/drugs without a valid prescription.  Follow through with AODA treatment/counseling.  Defendant not to reside with immediate members of his family.  Maintain full-time employment and/or school.  Attend a minimum of 2 self help meetings per week.
Sentencing hearing on June 29, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Andrew M Wapp in court, in custody, with attorney Nicholas Martinez and Daniel McMurray.   Barbara A. Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Prosecuting attorney moves to strike the repeater on Count 5.  Court grants motion.  Repeater struck from Count 5.  Information orally amended as to Count 9.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 5.  Court finds defendant guilty.  Counts 6, 7, 8, 9 and 10 dismissed and read in.  Court orders Presentence Investigation to be completed and report filed within 30 days.  Court orders bail revoked.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 29, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
